title: Colonialism and Militarism in Hawaii
description: Examines the history of Hawaii’s colonial present, beginning with incorporation into Euro-American imagining of the Pacific world. The course focuses on how colonialism took root in the nineteenth century and how it manifests in contemporary Hawaii through the military and tourist industries. Of particular emphasis are historical and contemporary struggles to demilitarize and decolonize Hawaii and to reclaim native Hawaiian sovereignty. Students may not receive credit for HIUS 119 and HIEU 119GS. Students must apply and be accepted to the Global Seminars Program.
